questions.text: A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
questions.explanation:
Speed = 60 km/hr = 60 * (5/18) m/sec = 50/3 m/sec. 

Time taken to cross the pole = 9 sec.

Length of Train = (Speed * Time) = (50/3 * 9) m = 150 metres.

questions.text: A train 125 m long passes a man, running at 5 km/hr in the same direction in which the train is going, in 10 seconds. The speed of the train is:
questions.explanation: Speed of the train relative to man = (125/10) m/sec = 12.5 m/sec. 12.5 m/sec = (12.5 * 18/5) km/hr = 45 km/hr. Let speed of train be x km/hr. Then, relative speed = (x - 5) km/hr. Therefore, x - 5 = 45 => x = 50 km/hr.

questions.text: The length of the bridge, which a train 130 metres long and travelling at 45 km/hr can cross in 30 seconds, is:
questions.explanation: Speed = 45 * 5/18 = 25/2 m/s. Time = 30 sec. Distance = (25/2 * 30) = 375m. Length of bridge = 375 - 130 = 245 m.

questions.text: A can do a work in 15 days and B in 20 days. If they work on it together for 4 days, then the fraction of the work that is left is:
questions.explanation: A's 1 day's work = 1/15. B's 1 day's work = 1/20. (A+B)'s 1 day's work = (1/15 + 1/20) = 7/60. (A+B)'s 4 days work = (7/60 * 4) = 7/15. Removing work = 1 - 7/15 = 8/15.

questions.text: The ratio of the volume of voids to the volume of soil solids in a given soil mass is known as:
questions.explanation: Void Ratio (e) = Volume of Voids / Volume of Solids.
